Recommended at the price
‘Killer Queen’ is about an escort – and she’s considered good value for money.
Caviar
In line with the song’s depiction of a superficially sophisticated woman, caviar is an expensive dish of sturgeon eggs

Then momentarily out of action (Ooh)
 Temporarily out of gas (Ta-taaa)
 To absolutely drive you wild, wild
 She’s out to get you

After being so readily available, she’s physically exhausted. She ran out of “gas to absolute drive you wild” represents this, as she’s too over exhausted to put on the readily sexual available act that comes with her life.
Fastidious and precise
She pays great attention to detail, most likely when pleasing her customers. (Fastidious means detail oriented)This is some what of a reference back to her rich vocabulary “speaking like a baroness”.
She’s a Killer Queen

According to Freddie himself in an interview with NME, the “Killer Queen” is a high class escort, although he also states that he’d prefer for people to interpret the track as they wish.

Overall, this woman is a camp baroness with a love of champagne and a great female affectation, who will ‘blow your mind’… as well as other bodily appendages.

Eric Hall, former publicist for EMI, stated in an interview for the documentary “The Story of Queen: Mercury Rising”, that Freddie told him that the song was written about him. However this has never been confirmed, and many believe it to be completely untrue.

In conversation
 She spoke just like a baroness

A baroness is well-educated, well-behaved, formal, and articulate.

A Baron is the lowest of nobile titles. While the subject in question is royal by most standards, she’s not quite as well-spoken as a princess or a queen. Her verbosity is, however, worth noting.
[Chorus]

The vocal here has been altered using a flanging effect, stacking two or more versions of the same vocal played at slightly different speeds. This technique is used to achieve an otherworldly feel and to match the tones of the accompanying guitar line.



Lyrically, this line further accentuates the undeniable attitude of the song’s subject.

Met a man from China
 Went down to Geisha Minah (Ooh, ooh)

Geisha Minor is a play on Asia Minor, a region in eastern Turkey.



A Geisha is a traditional Japanese female dancer, hostess, or entertainer; often confused for high-end prostitutes.
Perfume came naturally from Paris
Many famous perfumeries are located in Paris, France, including the famous Chanel company.
[Guitar Solo]

Queen guitarist Brian May, on how he recorded the guitar solo:

I had hepatitis, and then I had very bad stomach problems and I had to be operated on. So I remember just lying there, hearing Freddie play this really great song and feeling sad, because I thought, ‘I can’t even get out of bed to participate in this. Maybe the group will have to go on without me.’ No one could figure out what was wrong with me. But then I did go into the hospital and I got fixed up, thank God. And when I came out again, we were able to finish off ‘Killer Queen.’ They left some space for me and I did the solo.
